intro: Convolvulus serpylloides, commonly known as the slender morning glory, is a herbaceous annual plant native to the Mediterranean region. It features slender, twining stems that climb by means of tendrils, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. The plant produces small, funnel-shaped flowers that are typically blue or purple, blooming in the morning and closing by midday. Its leaves are alternate, heart-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields.
